description: The National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health is a United States government agency which explores complementary and alternative medicine . It was initially created in 1991 as the Office of Alternative Medicine , and renamed the National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine before receiving its current name in 2014. NCCIH is one of the 27 institutes and centers that make up the National Institutes of Health within the United States Department of Health and Human Services.
